author: Jun Kurosu

text: Always start with the first. I still feel the first was the best out of all of them. Instant classic.
author: Joshua Pruitt

text: They each have their own unique spin on things, but the newer Wild Arms games are worth playing for the music alone. Plus, the story and Filgaia lore are always interesting, and all the intricacies of the world throughout all the different timelines, all the different characters and their journeys, and all of the new crazy places to explore will ensure this series always holds a very dear place in my heart.
author: Joshua Pruitt

text:
I did play it and I admit it's a really good game!

Sometimes it gets so hard you can lose a battle if you make a single-turn mistake...
But the hex-grid is good and the class customization rocks!
One of the best PSP SRPG I played, along with Jeanne D'Arc.
author: nihilomen

text: Hey this is a pretty good song, I never played the Wild Arms series for some reason, but most of the music I heard is good from it.
author: notyoursavior78

text:
I loved Wild Arms, loved Wild Arms 2, thought Wild Arms 3 was decent enough, but not as good as the first two. I bought 4 without playing it and really didn't enjoy the grid-based battle system, so I sold it quick. Never played 5, but unless its much like the original two, I wouldn't be interested, unfortunately.

Nonetheless, thanks for the upload.

author: Kakashi Hatake

text: Wild Arms and Shadow Hearts, two JRPG series with awesome music I absolutely miss. This game felt like a love letter from Media.Vision, as if they knew it'd probably be the last game from the series. The first three will always remain the classic ones to me though, simply because of the more faithful western theme and Naruke's music.
